Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in Michael's office] Could you please sign my expense report?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No way, no how. Expense reports are a day-to-day item. That is Jim's now. I am exclusively big picture, epic.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in Jim's office] Sign this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ah, ah, ah. Where's the "please"? We're not animals.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Sign it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, not without a "please."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Idiot.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in Michael's office] I have a complaint about Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is not big picture.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I would like to file a huge, enormous, massive complaint about the tallest guy in our office.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ... Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim won't sign my expense report.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is not- okay- that is day-to-day.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, that is huge.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're trying to trick me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This has to do-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get out, get out, get out, get out, get out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [in Jim's office] I'd like to lodge a complaint.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry to hear about that. Who is this about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Just want to let you know I take complaints very seriously. So... When did this happen?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: One minute ago.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. And how do you feel?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angry.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. Did he hit you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you cry?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Did you feel like crying?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm just gonna write "held back tears."

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, stop writing that. That is not true.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: If you stop crying, I'll stop writing it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not cr- uhh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I deserved that promotion, not Jim. Oh, man. Makes me want to put him in a triangle choke hold and force him down to the ground and just keep pressing and pressing. And then flip him over and then put him in a hammer lock! And he's gasping, he's panting! Every last breath! And the crowd is going crazy. And boom! I emerge victorious! [claps hands and stands up] Aha! $18,000 and a chance at the title! Ooh hah!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [at the door] Dwight, Jim wants you to keep it down.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everyone, now would be a good time to freshen up, because I'd like everyone to meet in the conference room in five minutes. And I suggest that you bring a snack, because we may be in there for a while.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I talk to you in my office for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm, sure, but could I first talk to you in my office?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Can I also be a boss?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Look, it doesn't take a genius to know that any organization thrives when it has two leaders. Go ahead, name a country that doesn't have two presidents. A boat that sets sail without two captains. Where would Catholicism be without the popes?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I have noticed that we-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you. I've noticed we've been having a lot of conference room meetings.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I'm wondEring if perhaps those are a bit, um-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Disruptive.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I don't think they are. I think the meetings are very important.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, maybe we should talk specifics.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Let's do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Yesterday, we had a meeting about planets.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: N- well, to be fair, Jim... James... Jimothy... To be fair, Jimothy, the- ah, that sounds weird. Are you okay with being called Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I am.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. Jim, to be fair, the conversation wasn't about planets...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: At first, we were talking about introducing a line of toilet paper. And what part of the human body does one use toilet paper upon? So you draw a line from there to the other planets, and I think by the end, we all learned a little bit about how small we are.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes, I agree.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Because it's a big universe, and we're all just little, tiny specks of dust.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just think that maybe they're eating large amounts of the day.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what eats a large amount of the day are naps. You go to sleep, it's light out, you wake up, it's dark. That's the whole day. Where did that day go? I have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You mean on a weekend?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: How about this? I think our goal should be we don't have meetings unless they're absolutely essential.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright. No more meetings this week.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? You just agreed to that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can be very suprising.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I need to fit into my wedding dress. However, I'm also pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You know, it's a myth that women have to gain more than nine pounds in a pregnancy. Look at these actresses. Some of them lose weight.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hey, did you guys register for wedding gifts?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We did, but mostly because people expect us to. We're also accepting other gifts not on the registry... However much.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It's awkward asking people for money, but we could really use it. Why doesn't Crate & Barrel let you register for a toaster full of cash?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Perfect. I hate registries.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, good.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: My cousin makes the most amazing romantic birdhouse mailboxes. I know I shouldn't tell you, but you'll still be suprised when you see it. You're not registered for a birdhouse, are you?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, we're not.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Good. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [walks in, see's Oscar, Stanley, Creed and Kelly sitting in Michaels office] Okay, I thought I saw people missing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, just focus-grouping a product expansion idea to these folks. Got one of each.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really? Hey, Stanley, what was the last thing Michael said before I came through the door?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stanley, you don't need to answer that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: "If you don't smell this, you're fired."

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, Michael, I thought we agreed to not take up people's time with meetings like these.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you mean by "these people"?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, this is a conference room meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, hey, everybody, I think that Jim has gone insane, because he thinks that my office is a conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's not what I meant.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Listen, Jim, no offense, but when push comes to shove, what I want is more important that what you want.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I disagree.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What do you guys think? [all start talking at the same time]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great. Guys, can I just have a moment alone with Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no, you don't need to go anywhere. Anything that Jim has to say to me, he can say in front of these types of people.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is not what I said, and, also, I am co-manager, meaning you are not the only manager anymore. I am also I co-manager.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is not what Wallace told us.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's exactly what Wallace told us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is not the way I heard it.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I love rivalries- Michael or Jim, Paris or Nicole, Heidi or L.C. It's so much fun. But I guess if I'm really thinking about it and answEring your question honestly, I'd have to go with L.C. Heidi's a bad friend, and her skin is terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is one thing, me giving you the co-manager title. It is another thing, you bossing me around.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not bossing you around. I'm trying to do my job, which is sharing your job, so maybe we should just call David Wallace.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, no, no. No, we will not call David Wallace. [Michael pulls out his cell phone] I will call David Wallace.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: David Wallace is on line two for you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Or David Wallace will call us on line two. Why don't we just-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, David. You got Jim here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey David, this is Michael, senior co-manager.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Hey guys, um, I'm calling, because, unfortunately, we will not be able to give out cost of living raises this year, and I know people expect it. However, there just is only a small amount of money for each branch, so we're leaving it up to the managers to decide how to distribute it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Got it, Dave. Sounds like your classice big-picture decision.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Which will clearly affect the day-to-day well-being of our employees.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: It's probably a little of both.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Which is it more of?

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Excuse me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: David, I know that I'm very new at this, but I have a very good perspective on how things work.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Wait, I'm sorry. Michael, are you- are you texting me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I thought maybe we could talk after this is over.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Look, I need you both to take care of this. This is not going to be a problem, is it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope, not at all.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it will not be. I am on top of it.

Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: Very good.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, thanks alot, David.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Talk to you later- [Jim hangs up] Okay, you didn't let me say good-bye. [sighs, and claps hands once] Alright, I am looking forward to this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You don't have to lie.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I hate the fact that we have to do this together. I think we work better separately. When I am irritated and I look at you, I don't see you anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All I can see is how big and gross the pores on your nose are.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. Let's get started.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey, why haven't we ever, um...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: We have.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know, there's no easy way to do this. I say we add 1.5% to their paychecks and don't say anything about it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Do you mean, like break-in in the middle of the night and change the numbers on payroll?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, we can do it during the day. It doesn't have to be that dramatic, Jim.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. You know what would help is a pros and cons list for our options.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim, don't take this the wrong way. Are you gonna take this the wrong way?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's hard to tell so far.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You use your brain too much.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, are you advocating that I use it less?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sometimes the smartest people don't think at all.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You just came up with that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: As I was saying it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. Okay, so for the 1.5% increase, pro- everyone gets a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in nerdy voice] Con- you look like a nerd.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Con- no one gets as much as they did last year.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pro- you get to share your pros and cons list with the other nerds.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pro- no favoritism.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Con- you unzip your pants, and you find that there's a calculator down there.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I've been studying Michael for years, and I've condensed what I've learned into this chart- [pulls out a pie chart] How Michael spends his time. As you can see, we have procrastinating and distracting others, and this tiny sliver here is critical thinking. I made it bigger, so that you could see it.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Hey, Pam, I heard that you were registered, but I didn't hear where.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't think we registered anywhere. We just want cash.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Like money? Like you- you want my money?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Will you take a check?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Cool. In the memo line, I'm gonna write, "To love's eternal glory."

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wait til' Monday.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is this what I've become? Materialistic? Shallow? I feel horrible. [looks down at the check] oh look! "Mrs. Pam Halpert!" That's the first time I've seen it in writing!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You know, the more I think about it, the more I think we should give it to the salesmen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That will not go over well.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. I just think it seems smart to keep the salesmen happy right now. 'Course I know that this might come off as biased, so you know what? Let us...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, my God! Are you gonna make another pro and con list? I'm gonna kill myself.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna let you stop me from thinking.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No! I could not do that, Jim. I can see it in your crusty little eyes that you are going to make everything perfect. If I can just think this through, if I could just think it exactly right, I can make this perfect, and then I can go down every avenue, and every avenue off of that avenue, and then another avenue.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And then another-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look, you have a lot of strengths.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, I do?! Tell me what they are.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think that you are able to take constructive criticism very well.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ha! That- I am not known for that!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But there is a reason why I'm here!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes! You went over my head to Wallace!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it's because you also have a lot of weaknesses, Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Well, why don't you tell me what those are, Jim? Why don't you enliven me?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't think you're good at making tough decisions!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ah.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: At thinking out the options, and then stating that decision very clearly, especially when it's an unpopular decision.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, here's a tough decision for you. You suck! You suck! Is that clear enough for you?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: But maybe I'm here for a reason, because I might have some good ideas, too. I've been sitting out there, and I've been learning a lot, and maybe I can just bring something different to the table.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Skippy, here we go. Why don't you run yourself out there and tell them? [laughs] You call it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [leave the conference room to address everyone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [to the camera] This had better be terrible.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Could I have everyone's attention, please? I have some tough news, so I'm just gonna give it to you straight. Truth is, we only have so much money for raises this year, so the simple fact is some people will get raises, and some people won't. Now, what we've decided is, we are gonna give those raises to the sales staff.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wait. Seriously?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Look, you guys are smart, so I'm just leveling with you. I'm just trying to treat you like adults.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Thank you, Jim, for thinking that we're smart people.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But, I do not understand. If we're such smart adults, then why don't we get raises?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Excellent question, genius. It's because Jim wants to give the raises to his friends and the people he sleeps with.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh, easy. That's not it at all.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Really what it is, is about the money the sales staff brings into the office.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [walks in from shopping, with bags in her hands] What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Jim is only giving raises to the salesmen.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What the hell?! Why are you being such a jerk?!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hold on, Kelly. Would it help you to know that Jim thinks you're smart?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: No! [put's down her bags] How is that gonna repair Ryan's car?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is ridiculous! How could he do this to us?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, Dwight, you know what? You'd be getting the raise so-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What about all these people, huh?! How is it fair to them?!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Exactly!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Totally!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We work just as hard as the sales people. We deserve raises.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes. They don't get 'em, if we don't get 'em!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: My kid needs shoes! You want to tell him he doesn't get shoes?!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Her kid needs shoes, Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What the hell?! [everyone complaining at Jim]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wow! I'm just gonna rewind and back off a bit, so... [imitates a tape rewinding and chuckles, Michael comes over by Jim laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was good! That was good! Okay, all right. Well, we all know it's hard to be a boss, right? You know what? Look around you. These are your best friends. These are the people who will open their hearts to you. They all have heart-ons for you [someone growns in disgust], and that is a gift. So in terms of gifts, we should be giving each other gifts. Angela, yes, lend Oscar a cup of sugar. This-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What are you talking about Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We just need to hear your plan for our raise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My plan- a man- panama.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's not how that goes.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You're not saying anything. At least Jim was being direct...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Thank you, Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: ...when he was telling us his dumbass plan.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: We would just like to know what's happening. Are we getting a raise, yes or no?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright! Let me get this clear! Does everybody want a raise? [all say yes] Alright, everyone wants a raise, so what we're going to do is go into here, and we will not come out until we do.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Again, that gives us no information.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: This isn't a game, you know? It's our livelihood!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What about a raise based on merit?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Rank each person individually?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm. Piece of cake. Ryan, obviously the best.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [sarcastically] Well, obviously. Too bad he's a temp and doesn't count, so let's get started. [starts to write on a piece of paper]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you making a-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope. I'm numbering the paper.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [everyone talking to the camera] Just-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, I don't understand how they can even consider giving money to some people and not the rest of us.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's not like we're not gonna see the checks. We're in accounting!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I am so pissed at this company!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [out the side of his mouth] And Jim!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Yeah. Who said that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I think it was Creed.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to camera] It's going really well, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to camera, holds up a bean] Each Boston Baked Bean represents half a percent raise. We each got 24 beans, so the idea is, you place the bean on the picture [walking around the table] of who you think deserv- who's that? [picture that Michael drew of toby, looks like a monster]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Toby.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He's not a part of this. You know that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just wanted to draw a picture of him.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, your move.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Alright! Who to pick? [walking around the table] Who to pick?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I... will skip a turn.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay, you're gonna still have to play that bean. You know that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I need more time.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Wallace sent an e-mail about a meeting next week. He wants you both to respond. [Michael and Jim leave, Dwight sneaks in]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: People are starting to notice how terrible Jim is. It's great. Eventually, they'll rise up and revolt. My only hope is that they do it sooner rather than later. If the people here were our founding fathers, the Revolutionary War would have been delayed ten years, because Stanley Washington was napping, and Phyllis Hancock was still signing the declaration, and Kevin Jefferson was distracted by a butterfly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Come on in. [everyone looking around at all the pictures and beans on the table] That's right. Come in, feast your eyes. They determine our worth by putting beans upon our faces.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: What the hell?!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Things were not this bad when just Michael was manager.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, what are you guys doing in here?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What does a bean mean?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Why aren't there any beans on this very old, frizzy-haired picture of me?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael, what does a bean mean?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I was just trying to be unbiased.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What does a bean mean?!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Someone please explain it to Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Why can't you? My time is just as valuable as yours.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Not according to the beans.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is how you make this important decision?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: There's no way that Stanley gets more beans than me. [starts to take Stanley's beans, Stanley swats Andy's hand with his crossword puzzle] That is ridiculous. This is how it works. [everyone continues to argue]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's not so much that I might not get a raise. It's just demeaning!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you! That is exactly- by the way, I would also like a raise.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah, I would, too.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Are we idiots? [gets up, starts walking around] What right does Jim have to claim authority, hmm? Is he as good a salesman as I? Is he as matronly as Phyllis? There are moments where we can affect change. For a few seconds every decade, we exist, and these are those seconds! Let us storm his castle! Come on! Tick- let's get him. Tock- let's get Jim! Tick- and drag Jim out of his office! Tock- take his keys away from him! Tick- that's a clock! The time is getting very close! It's now or never! What say you?!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I say no.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I mean, what do you say to my plan? [all groan] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [leaving his office, hurrying to Jim's office]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What does a bean mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [in Jim's office] How you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Uh, on a scale of one to ten, I'd say I'm about a four.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, what are you usually?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Six. You?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Usually a ten, but I'm feeling like a zero.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I mean, a performance-based raise sounded like a good idea, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know, I know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We tried to find the fairest way to do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, we did.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I just- what?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Um, nothing. I just... I used to have to do this part alone, and it was the worst. I have something I would like to give you. [leaves office]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Come on! This isn't fair!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [to camera] Michael's my only friend left in the office. Except Pam... I think. Is she still upset?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: [at Michael return to Jim's office] Michael, you cannot just keep avoiding us like this!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [Michael give Jim a "World's Best Boss" mug] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What's in here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Gin. [toast, sip]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ooh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [someone knocks] Just pretend we're not here.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Heard you guys are looking for cash for the wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I mean, if it's all the same for you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Question for you. Would you guys rather have $100 now, or $5,000 a year from now?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: $100 now for sure.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Because you just give me $50 to cover the broker fee, I put in a hundred of my own money as the gift...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. No, no, I'll um- the hundred. I'll just take the hundred.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Instead of $5,000 a year from now?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How sure is this?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: The guy has an algorithm to determine the winner of any given college basketball game.
